title: [Large-Scale] Emotional Labor Management Strategies in Online Education: Strengthening Social Interaction and Citizenship

context.prior_knowledge: Over three years of online education experience, experience in operating secondary education programs, experience managing social relationships in educational settings
context.additional_context: As an in-service secondary education practitioner, responsible for managing online corporate training programs. Focuses on building civic relationships with learners and establishing educational communities.

learning_goals: At least three emotional labor elements of educators in online interactions (e.g., emotion regulation, role conflict, relationship maintenance) can be identified and explained from a socio-psychological perspective.
Emotional regulation strategies in text-based communication (e.g., empathetic language, boundary setting) can be applied to real educational scenarios through role-play.

Techniques for enhancing emotional presence in voice-based online classes—such as tone, pronunciation, pacing, and empathetic intonation—can be practiced to develop relationship-building strategies with learners.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
